Barr-Beck for QCoh

Feb 16, 2020

Let be a symmetric monoidal stable category, and suppose there is a functor (which means the derived category of -vector spaces, but really I could replace this with the category of modules over any -ring, or in fact any presentable stable category) satisfying the following properties:

  • admits a left adjoint;
  • is conservative;
  • preserves geometric realizations of -split simplicial objects (i.e., simplicial objects which split after applying ).

Then there is an algebra such that , and such that is the forgetful map whose left adjoint is given by tensoring with . This a special case of the Barr-Beck-Lurie theorem.

The motivating question in this post is the following: what conditions can we impose on to guarantee that there is a stack such that ? Obviously, the conditions of Barr-Beck-Lurie suffice, but being on a stack is weaker than being modules over an algebra.

Here is a condition that I think works. Suppose admits a functor (the target could in fact be the category of modules over any -ring) such that admits a left adjoint, and such that there is an -algebra object such that

  • the thick tensor ideal of generated by is equivalent to ;
  • the functor is conservative and preserves geometric realizations of -simplicial objects.

Then we claim that there exists an fpqc stack over such that . Let’s see why this is true.

There is a functor with a left adjoint (given by tensoring with ). The composite sending an -module in to then satisfies the conditions of Barr-Beck. The point is that if is an -module, then the cosimplicial diagram splits, and so since preserves limits and is conservative, we find that is conservative on -module objects. The functor also preserves geometric realizations of simplicial objects. By Barr-Beck, this gets you that .

Now, we claim that is comonadic. Indeed, it’s conservative, so we need to check that this forgetful functor preserves limits of cosimplicial diagrams which split after tensoring with . In other words, we need to show that . It in turn suffices to show that is pro-constant. Now is pro-constant, because it’s split cosimplicial. The subcategory of generated by those such that is pro-constant is obviously a thick tensor ideal, and so it contains the unit. That’s what we wanted.

Therefore, for the coalgebra . Then since , we find that is the fpqc stack presented by the Hopf algebroid . In order for to be a quasi-geometric stack (in the sense of Section 9.1 of SAG), the diagonal needs to be quasi-affine. There are probably formal ways to ensure that this is the case.
